TopicTitle: Does anyone here have a Hohmann transfer diagram?

Articles.Content:
A description of the picture: It is roughly square, and has a green spiral on it indicating a Hohmann transfer window.

I saw it in an Imgur album demonstrating its use in KSP (which makes this picture very useful), but I can't find it. So, does anyone have a link or file to it?

Perhaps this?

Nah, it's not a green spiral. Anyway, Google Image Search is your friend.
There is this one too, which is green and fairly popular from the wiki.

This one, maybe?

Edit: Or possibly this:

Edited April 15, 2014 by Red Iron Crown

To the users above:

No, not exactly. It's just a solid black background a green spiral for Hohmann transfers.

I remember that you use it by putting it on your computer screen, wait for the target to hit the green line, and start burning.

Hmm, that sounds like an old method to me. Such as in before there were maneuver nodes.

You could try seaching some of the protractor threads, although that search might be overrun by the protractor mod.
You may mean this link: http://imgur.com/a/AGQF5

You may mean this link: http://imgur.com/a/AGQF5

That is so cool! Amazing that it works IRL too.

You may mean this link: http://imgur.com/a/AGQF5

This doesn't account eccentricity and inclination, so basically it's better to install kerbal alarm clock or use the olex.biz calculator.
